channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This New Designer Kitchen Tool Is Just a Stick. So Why Are We Obsessed With It?
item.description: Stir with it, flip with it, cook with it—a Danish kitchenware studio has reinvented man’s OG tool.

item.title: DeepSeek gets Silicon Valley talking
item.description: Since Chinese AI company DeepSeek released an open version of its reasoning model R1 at the beginning of this week, many in the tech industry have bee...

item.title: Why Reid Hoffman feels optimistic about our AI future

item.title: TalkTalk investigating data breach after hacker claims theft of customer data
item.description: A hacker claims to be selling the data of 18.8 million TalkTalk customers, but the telecoms giant says this figure is ‘significantly overstated’ © 202...

item.title: Scammers Are Creating Fake News Videos to Blackmail Victims
item.description: “Yahoo Boy” scammers are impersonating CNN and other news organizations to create videos that pressure victims into making blackmail payments.

item.title: Emergency Braking Will Save Lives. Automakers Want to Charge Extra for It

item.title: How to Use Stolen Device Protection on Apple’s iPhone

item.title: Perplexity submits a new bid for TikTok
item.description: Perplexity AI has submitted a revised proposal to merge with TikTok, in an arrangement that would give the U.S. government up to 50 percent ownership ...

item.title: DeepSeek ‘punctures’ AI leaders’ spending plans, and what analysts are saying
item.description: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek has emerged as a potential challenger to U.S. AI companies, demonstrating breakthrough models that claim to offer performance...

item.title: Here It Is, the Worst Slack Bug
item.description: A glitch in Slack makes it possible to accidentally send your entire DM history with one person to other coworkers. Ask me how I know.
